file_name: VirtuosoSurgicalInc_20191227_1-A_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_11933379_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_License Agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
2.2 “LICENSED FIELD” shall mean Cannulated Surgical Intervention.

3.1 License Granted: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and to non-exclusive license agreements executed prior to the EFFECTIVE DATE, JHU hereby grants to the Company a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to make, have made, import, offer for sale and sell the LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and the LICENSED SERVICE(S) in the United States and worldwide under the PATENT RIGHT(S) in the LICENSED FIELD.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.2 “LICENSED FIELD” shall mean Cannulated Surgical Intervention unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties.

3.1 License Granted: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and to non-exclusive license agreements executed prior to the EFFECTIVE DATE, JHU hereby grants to the Company a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to make, have made, import, offer for sale and sell the LICENSED PRODUCT(S) and the LICENSED SERVICE(S) in the United States and worldwide under the PATENT RIGHT(S) in the LICENSED FIELD.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defined the “LICENSED FIELD” as “Cannulated Surgical Intervention.” The modified text adds "unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties," introducing ambiguity. This contradicts the later section granting a license within the initially defined LICENSED FIELD because the scope of that field is now uncertain. It is unclear if subsequent agreements can alter this definition.

perturbation.original_text:
6.2 Termination by Company: Company may terminate this Agreement and the license granted herein, for any reason, upon giving JHU sixty (60) days written notice under Paragraph 8.1.

7.1 Default & Termination: Upon breach or default of any term or condition of this Agreement by either party, the defaulting party shall be given written notice of such default in writing by the party not in default. The defaulting party shall have a period of sixty (60) days after receipt of such notice to correct the default or breach. If the default or breach is not corrected within said sixty (60) day period, the party not in default shall have the right to terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.2 Termination by Company: Company may terminate this Agreement and the license granted herein, for any reason, upon giving JHU sixty (60) days written notice under Paragraph 8.1. However, should Virtuoso Surgical, Inc. be in material breach, the right to terminate is suspended until the breach is resolved.

7.1 Default & Termination: Upon breach or default of any term or condition of this Agreement by either party, the defaulting party shall be given written notice of such default in writing by the party not in default. The defaulting party shall have a period of sixty (60) days after receipt of such notice to correct the default or breach. If the default or breach is not corrected within said sixty (60) day period, the party not in default shall have the right to terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Section 6.2 explicitly states that the Company can terminate for *any* reason with 60 days' notice. I added an exception: "However, should Virtuoso Surgical, Inc. be in material breach, the right to terminate is suspended until the breach is resolved." This directly contradicts the 'any reason' clause, creating uncertainty. The company's right to terminate is now conditional, even though the original clause made it seem absolute. It is unclear when this suspension applies, if ever. This potentially impacts the balance of power between the parties.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1 License Fee: As consideration for JHU’s grant of a License to Company under this Agreement, Company shall pay to JHU a license fee, cash and equity, as set forth in Exhibit A within thirty (30) days of the EFFECTIVE DATE. The license fee is nonrefundable and shall not be credited against royalties or other fees.

4.2 Minimum Annual Royalties: Company shall pay to JHU minimum annual royalties as set forth in Exhibit A. These minimum annual royalties shall be due within thirty (30) days of each anniversary of the EFFECTIVE DATE beginning with the first anniversary.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1 License Fee: As consideration for JHU’s grant of a License to Company under this Agreement, Company shall pay to JHU a license fee, cash and equity, as set forth in Exhibit A within thirty (30) days of the EFFECTIVE DATE. The license fee may be refundable under certain conditions outlined in a separate addendum and shall not be credited against royalties or other fees unless JHU gives written consent.

4.2 Minimum Annual Royalties: Company shall pay to JHU minimum annual royalties as set forth in Exhibit A. These minimum annual royalties may be waived under certain conditions, as determined at JHU's sole discretion. These minimum annual royalties shall be due within thirty (30) days of each anniversary of the EFFECTIVE DATE beginning with the first anniversary.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 4.1, the original text states the license fee is "nonrefundable." I changed it to "may be refundable under certain conditions outlined in a separate addendum," contradicting the nonrefundable nature. Additionally, the statement that the fee "shall not be credited against royalties or other fees" is weakened by adding "unless JHU gives written consent." Then, for Section 4.2, I added "may be waived under certain conditions, as determined at JHU's sole discretion." This creates uncertainty because the conditions are not specified. The obligation to pay minimum annual royalties is no longer definite.
